speaker: GRISSOM
line: AH! Calls 911

speaker: OPERATOR
line: 911 operator, please state emergency.

speaker: GRISSOM
line: Yeah, this is Dr. Saul Grissom. There’s a fire outside my apartment. I’m trapped.

speaker: OPERATOR
line: Are you at 700 East 56th street?

speaker: GRISSOM
line: Yes, apt. 606. For god’s sake, hurry

speaker: OPERATOR
line: Fire units are being dispatched right now, sir. Please stay on the line.

speaker: GRISSOM
line: Somebody help! Ah! Flames consume the room and he starts to choke from smoke inhalation as firemen race up the stairs. A large black man is seen going down the stairs. Much chaos and shouting.

speaker: FIREMAN 1
line: Get a crew up to the roof!

speaker: LT. REAGAN
line: This is Lt. Reagan and we have a possible 23 false alarm in apartment six-zero-six. Let’s confirm that location, 606.

speaker: WOMAN AT OTHER END OF RADIO
line: Yes, that’s affirmative, 606.

speaker: REAGAN
line: It’s cold, let’s do it! The men break in the door and find nothing but Grissom’s dead body

speaker: FIREMAN
line: He looks dead. Mulder opens his paper at his apartment and a tape falls out along with Dr. Grissom’s article circled.

speaker: MULDER
line: The article makes no mention of the fire.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Yes, Agent Mulder, I can read.

speaker: MULDER
line: Grissom’s company had a number of government contracts which would place this investigation within the Bureau’s jurisdiction.

speaker: SKINNER
line: But that’s not why you want the assignment.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think that the circumstances surrounding Grissom’s death warrant a closer look. I called NYPD but they won’t even talk to me unless I get the Attorney General to sign off on it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where’d you get the tape. Presumably, someone had led you to believe that there is more here than is being reported.

speaker: MULDER
line: My source, the only one I have ever trusted, is dead.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I’ll look into this further and I’ll let you know. In the mean time, you have 24 hours of wiretap that needs to be transcribed.

speaker: PERSON ON TAP
line: Are you comin’ over or what? You said you was comin’ over two hours ago and I’m waitin’ here like some stupid bimbo who ain’t got nothin’ better to do with her time. . . Mulder rewinds tape some

speaker: PERSON
line: . . .waitin’ here like some stupid bimbo who ain’t got nothin’ better to do with her time than to sit around here waitin’ for you.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: It’s your 302. Assistant Director Skinner just approved it.

speaker: MULDER
line: There’s a mistake here. There’s been another agent assigned to the case.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: That would be me. Krycek, Alex Krycek.

speaker: MULDER
line: Skinner didn’t say anything about taking on a new partner.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: It wasn’t Skinner. Actually, I opened the file 2 Hours before your request so technically, it’s my case.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you all ready talked to the police?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yeah, just hung up on the officer in charge a few minutes ago. A detective named Whorton. Turns out Grissom called 911 to report a fire.

speaker: MULDER
line: I heard the tape.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Did you hear that forensics found a spent fire extinguisher on the floor. Grissom’s prints were all over it. The walls and floor in his living room were covered with ammonium phosphate.

speaker: MULDER
line: But no trace of a fire.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Not even a burnt match.

speaker: MULDER
line: That all you know?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: So far. What do you think it means?

speaker: MULDER
line: Listen, I appreciate the show and tell, and I don’t want you to take this personally, but I work alone. I’ll straighten things out with Skinner.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: It’s my case, Agent Mulder. Look, I may be---green, but I had the case first and I’m not going to give it away so quickly.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, I’ll tell you what, I got a little work to finish up around here. Why don’t you go down to the motor pool and requisition us a car and I’ll meet you down there.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: That’s all. I mean you don’t have a problem with us working together.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s your party.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Well, um, I’ll get the car. Krycek walks away with a satisfied smile and Mulder watches him go.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Electrocution effects electrolytic conduction, disrupting the heart beat and most of the autonomic systems. Death actually occurs from tissue damage, and necrosis in the heart itself, particularly in the sinus and the atria ventricular nodes. . .

speaker: MAN
line: Agent Scully, sorry to interrupt, but you have a call from a George Hale, says it’s urgent.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Excuse me. Scully picks up the phone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: National airport. Catching the shuttle up to Laguardia in a half an hour. How do you feel about joining me in the ‘Big Apple’ for an autopsy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What’s going on?

speaker: MULDER
line: I was hoping you could tell me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I can’t do it today. My last class isn’t until 4:30.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s fine. I can have the ME wrap the body to go

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder. . .

speaker: MULDER
line: You’ll get it by five.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What’s the name?

speaker: NURSE
line: Dr. Grissom’s alpha-wave analysis defined the standard, he revolutionized the way we think about sleep. His death was a tremendous loss to the scientific community.

speaker: MULDER
line: How many other kinds of sleep disorder did he treat?

speaker: NURSE
line: There are 38 different dissomnias and parasomnias. Dr. Grissom treated them all with an unprecedented success ratio.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maintaining that kind of batting average must have taken it’s toll.

speaker: NURSE
line: Excellence demands certain sacrifices.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did he ever show any signs of psychological stress?

speaker: NURSE
line: Not really. Except for his own occasional bout of insomnia.

speaker: MULDER
line: But he was never delusional.

speaker: NURSE
line: Of course not.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s his story?

speaker: NURSE
line: This patient’s night terrors prevent him from cycling out REM sleep into the more restful slow wave sleep. It’s still experimental, but what we’re trying to do is modify his brain wave patterns externally.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you do that?

speaker: NURSE
line: Electrical stimulation of the occipital lobe creates simply visual and auditory hallucinations.

speaker: MULDER
line: So it’s actually possible to alter somebody’s dreams?

speaker: NURSE
line: In theory, yes.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I paid off your cab. Hey, I don’t appreciate being ditched like someone’s bad date

speaker: MULDER
line: I’m sorry if I hurt your feelings.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Where do you get off copping this attitude. You don’t even know the first thing about me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Exactly.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You know, back at the academy, some of the guys used to make fun of you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh stop it, or you’ll hurt my feelings.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: But there were some of us who followed your work. Believed what you were doing because we knew that there was more out there than they were telling us. Mulder’s cell phone rings.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Grissom didn’t die from cardiac arrest.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think you should come down and take a look for yourself. I haven’t even started on the chest and abdomen yet and I’ll have a lot more to tell you then.

speaker: MULDER
line: I can make it in two hours. Mulder reaches for the door. Krycek holds up the keys.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Where are we going.

speaker: MULDER
line: Spleen or pancreas?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stomach. I was just about to start on it.

speaker: MULDER
line: This is Alex Krycek. We’re, uh, working the case together.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Good to meet you.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You too. He holds out his hand, she walks right by it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Notice the pugilistic attitude of the corpse. Krycek coughs into fist, loudly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This condition generally occurs several hours after death. It’s caused by a coagulation of muscle proteins when the body is exposed to extremely high temperatures.

speaker: MULDER
line: Like fire?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This degree of limb flexion is observed exclusively in burn-related victims.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: But there was no fire.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And no epidermal burns to indicate as much but when I opened up the skull, I found external hemorrhages, which can only be caused by intense heat. Some how, this man suffered all of the secondary, but none of the primary physiological signs of being in a fire.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any theories?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I couldn’t even begin to explain what could have caused this. It’s almost as if. . .

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It’s almost as if his body believed that it was burning.

speaker: COLE
line: You left the door open, Willie.

speaker: HENRY
line: Preacher?

speaker: COLE
line: Not a good idea leaving your door open in this neighborhood. You never know who’s gonna drop by.

speaker: HENRY
line: What are you doin’ here? How long ya been in town? Want a beer?

speaker: COLE
line: How ya doin’, Henry? Huh? How ya been?

speaker: HENRY
line: How am I doin’? I’m, uh,---tryin’ to forget. You know. I’m trying to get it out of my head.

speaker: COLE
line: No luck?

speaker: HENRY
line: And I’m, uh, still fightin’ it, you know. I keep seein’ the faces. Every day I see---aw, what’s the difference. We’re all goin’ to Hell, right?

speaker: COLE
line: Where you think we been the last 24 years? After this, whatever you is gonna seem like you get a wine invitation.

speaker: HENRY
line: What do you want here, Preacher? You killed them, didn’t you. You killed Grissom, I saw it on TV

speaker: COLE
line: He had to pay, Henry. All of us have to answer for what did over there---can’t get away from it. Many Vietnamese people appear, holding guns

speaker: HENRY
line: No.

speaker: COLE
line: He retains that is anger forever because he delights in mercy. He will turn again. He will have compassion on us. He will subdue our inequities and he will cast all our sins into the depths of the sea. It’s all right, Henry. It’s all over now. The Vietnamese people raise their guns and fire at Henry, killing him.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: The victim’s name was Henry Willig. Unemployed and lived on disability. Police found no indication of force entry of struggle, no abrasions or contusions on the body and cause of death is being listed as a burst aneurysm.

speaker: MULDER
line: So, why did your friend from homicide call us.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Because the medical examiner called him. The autopsy revealed forty-three small internal hemorrhages and skeletal fragments which doesn’t just happen spontaneously. Not without some corresponding external trauma.

speaker: MULDER
line: So what does the ME have to say about it?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: He said if he didn’t know otherwise, he would swear they were gunshot wounds.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s this scar right here?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: According to his medical history, the only surgery he ever had was an appendectomy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, unless they got to his appendix through his neck.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Maybe it happened during Vietnam. Willig did a tour with the Marines in 1970, and I’m sure they didn’t keep the best of records.

speaker: MULDER
line: Willig was a Marine? So where do all Marines receive basic training on the East coast?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Parris Island.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where Grissom was stationed from 1968 to 1971.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Which means that he and Willig were there at the same time, 24 years ago.

speaker: MULDER
line: Here we go. Willig was assigned to Special Forces on Re-con squad J-7. Of thirteen original members, he’s one of two survivors.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Until yesterday.

speaker: MULDER
line: This leaves us with one person who can tell us what happened on Parris Island.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I’ve been supervising Mr. Cole’s treatment since I admitted him twelve years ago. ‘Fraid you won’t find him very cooperative, though.

speaker: MULDER
line: We just want to ask him a few questions about his military service.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: He doesn’t respond very well to authority figures.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is that why you put him in isolation?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Oh, we’ve had to house Mr. Cole in this section of the ward because he kept interfering with our treatment of the other patients.

speaker: MULDER
line: How was he interfering?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: He was disrupting their sleep patterns. Psychiatric patients especially, it’s critical that the Circadian cycles be strictly maintained. . .

speaker: MULDER
line: Excuse me, but exactly how would Cole disrupt their sleep?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Here we are. Mr. Cole, there are some gentlemen here to. . . Cole is not in his cell when the door is opened.

speaker: RECEPTIONIST
line: You discharged him just a few days ago.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: I most certainly did not. Don’t you think I would remember if I did.

speaker: RECEPTIONIST
line: Well, I was on shift, Doctor. You signed the order yourself. That’s your signature, isn’t it?

speaker: MULDER
line: Let’s get Cole’s face onto the wire. Mulder’s cell phone rings.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: X
line: Mr. Mulder. I have obtained some information that may shed some light on your current work. You must exercise discretion when we meet. If anyone follows you, I won’t be there.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who are you?

speaker: X
line: Who I am is irrelevant.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why are you trying to help me?

speaker: X
line: You think I want to be here, Agent Mulder? I don’t want to be here.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is this?

speaker: X
line: Data from a top secret military project. Borne of the idea that sleep was the soldiers greatest enemy.

speaker: MULDER
line: Of course. Someone was conducting sleep deprivation experiments on Parris Island.

speaker: X
line: Not deprivation, eradication.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why?

speaker: X
line: Why else? To build a better soldier. Sustained wakefulness dulls fear, heightens aggression. Science had just put a man on the moon. So they looked to science to win a losing war.

speaker: MULDER
line: And Willig and Cole were the lab rats.

speaker: X
line: Lab rats with the highest kill ratio in the marine corps. 4,000 plus confirmed kills for a thirteen man squad.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think Cole’s behind what’s happening now?

speaker: X
line: I’m not here to do your thinking, Agent Mulder. All I know is Augustus Cole hasn’t slept in 24 years. There’s someone else you should see. A member of the squad who was reportedly killed in action.

speaker: MULDER
line: I thought Cole was the last.

speaker: X
line: His name is on the envelope.

speaker: MULDER
line: So how do I contact you?

speaker: X
line: You can’t

speaker: MULDER
line: I may still need more.

speaker: X
line: You still don’t get it, do you? Closing the X-Files, separating you and Scully was only the beginning. The truth is still out there, but it’s never been more dangerous. The man we both knew paid for that information with his life, a sacrifice I’m not willing to make.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Where were ya? Someone matching Cole’s description just robbed a drugstore in Queens and the place is located under a motel just around the corner.

speaker: MULDER
line: Is he alive?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: He was when the night man just saw him. So where were ya? They enter the hotel.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Detective Whorton? I’m Agent Krycek, this is Agent Mulder

speaker: WHORTON
line: I’ve been waiting for you guys. I tried holding the swat guys back but they’re getting a little antsy. For what it’s worth, Cole didn’t steal dime-one from that drug store, just a bunch of pills. Three gunshots are fired and a scream is heard. Mulder and Krycek race up the stairs.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Inside, NOW! Officer down!

speaker: MAN
line: We got two officers down, request emergency vehicles, immediately. Cole is seen against the wall outside.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What’s going on here Mulder? These two officers, they shot each other.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Also in the described in the report, is a highly experimental neurosurgical procedure meant to induce a permanent waking state. The procedure involved cutting out part of the brainstem in the mid-frontal region which would explain Henry Willig’s scar. A similar scar should also be evident on Augustus Cole. Post-op treatment also included a regiment of synthetic supplements to replenish the organic deficits caused by prolong lack of sleep. This is consistent with the anti-depressants Cole robbed from the pharmacy. These drugs maintain serotonin levels in the blood. Serotonin being the primary substance produced during sleep. While it is theoretically possible that this procedure greatly diminished the subjects need for sleep, I can neither quantify nor substantiate it’s success without further clinical evidence. Telephone rings.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Scully

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, that second officer is still in a coma, so I don’t think we can count on him to give us an answer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I’m going over these reports you faxed me. They’re incredible.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, the military all ready sent troops to radioactive mushroom clouds, I guess they figured they had to top themselves, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sleep eradication still doesn’t explain the shooting of those two officers, or the anomalous autopsy results on Willig and Dr. Grissom.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I learned something at Dr. Grissom’s clinic. About what happens to a persons cortex when you stimulate it with electricity.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They experience mild visual and auditory hallucinations, any first year med. student could tell you that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what if that stimulus were to come from a remote source? What if Cole had somehow developed the ability to project his unconscious.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Are you suggesting that Cole killed these people with telepathic images?

speaker: MULDER
line: Think about it, Scully. In all those years without REM sleep, maybe Cole built a bridge between the waking world and the dream world. A collective unconscious. And what if, by existing consciously in the unconscious world, he developed the ability to externalize his dreams and effectively alter reality.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Even if you’re right, you’ll have a much better chance of finding Cole if you work up a profile and try to surmise his next move.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, I’ll sharpen my pencils and I’ll see you later. Krycek beckons towards Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: I’ll be right there, Krycek.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are you going?

speaker: MULDER
line: We’re gonna check out another member of the squad and see if he can tell us anything about Cole.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sounds like your new partner’s working out.

speaker: MULDER
line: He’s all right. He could use a little more seasoning and some wardrobe advice But he’s a lot more open to extreme possibilities then. . .

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then I was?

speaker: MULDER
line: . . .then I assumed he would be.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Must be nice not having someone question your every move, poking holes in all your theories.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh yeah, it’s---it’s great. I’m surprised I put up with you so long.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You’d better go. I’ll read over this report again and see what else I can come up with.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay. Hangs up phone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Salvatore Matola?

speaker: MATOLA
line: You gonna shoot me? You gonna kill me?

speaker: MULDER
line: We’re with the FBI. We just want to ask you some questions. Why’d you think we were gonna kill you?

speaker: MATOLA
line: I dunno.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know about Willig and Grissom.

speaker: MOTOLA
line: I read about it in the paper. I guess they’re finally killin’ us all off.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who? Hey Sal, can you spare a few minutes?

speaker: MATOLA
line: I guess so. I got a break comin’ up. Spare a few minutes. I guess. They said it’s be like living two lifetimes. At---at first, that’s what it was like. Not having to sleep at all made us feel like nothin’ could touch us, you know? We’d do 24 hour patrols, night ambushes, you know, and that type of thing.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you never got tired?

speaker: MATOLA
line: No. Not so that we had to sleep. And then, nothing that the pills couldn’t fix.

speaker: MULDER
line: Serotonin?

speaker: MATOLA
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: How long did this go on?

speaker: MATOLA
line: Quite awhile, I’d say. Quite awhile until we stopped taking orders from the company commander in Saigon.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You mean the entire squad went AWOL?

speaker: MATOLA
line: Yeah, somethin’ like that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, then who did you take orders from?

speaker: MATOLA
line: We just made up missions as we went along, until it didn’t matter anymore who we were killing. Farmers, women. Outside of Phu Bai, there was this school, they were just kids.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: No one ever tried to stop you?

speaker: MATOLA
line: No, sir.

speaker: MULDER
line: We suspect that Augustus Cole may be behind the murders of Willig and Grissom.

speaker: MATOLA
line: Preacher? That’s what we used to call him on account that he was always reading from his bible, saying this and that about judgment day. Sayin’ that we’ll have to pay for what we were doin'. That’s what he said back then, that’s what he’s sayin’.

speaker: MULDER
line: But why Grissom. He was never in country, he wasn’t even part of the squadron.

speaker: MATOLA
line: Sure he was. He made us what we are. Him and Dr. Gerardi.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who’s Gerardi?

speaker: MATOLA
line: The other Doc. The one who did the surgeries on us. It’s because of him, I haven’t slept a night in 24 years.

speaker: MULDER
line: We’re going after Gerardi. Cole sees himself as a kind of avenging angel. In his mind, everyone responsible for the atrocities, whether directly or indirectly, must be punished.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yeah, but why now. Why after all these years.

speaker: MULDER
line: Phu Bai was one of the bloodiest massacres of the war. Over 300 children slaughtered. But unlike My Lai, no US troops were ever charged. The 24th anniversary of the massacre was two days ago. Mulder’s cell phone rings.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think I found the Francis Gerardi you’re looking for. He’s a professor of neurosurgery at Harvard.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you have his number in Boston?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, except he’s coming to New York for Grissom’s funeral,

speaker: MULDER
line: Try to have a photograph waiting for us at the security desk so we know who we’re looking for, okay?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Got it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Stay here, I’ll cover you on the side. Mulder thinks he sees Gerardi..

speaker: MULDER
line: Federal Agent! Drop your weapon. Mulder fires four shots. Krycek runs towards him.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Gerardi! Where is he?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Gerardi’s not here.

speaker: MULDER
line: I saw him.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Mulder! You were shouting and waving your gun around, but Gerardi never showed.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, Gerardi was here, and so was Cole. We just missed them.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Mulder, if they had been here, I would have seen it. I’m telling you Mulder, they weren’t here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, there’s nothing here. Start with a small window of time, say 1935 to 1945. If you don’t find anything in that time frame, then open it up one minute at a time. With all these cameras, we should be able to see something.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Can we talk for a second.

speaker: MULDER
line: What’s the problem.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You still haven’t answered my question. What happened?

speaker: MULDER
line: I told you, I thought I saw Gerardi.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Come on, you just about killed somebody back there. We both know I’m covering for you by keeping it between us.

speaker: MULDER
line: All right, what do you want to know.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What’s the truth? There are things you’re not telling me that I need to know.

speaker: MULDER
line: It’s just that my ideas usually aren’t very popular.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I told you, I want to believe. But I need a place to start.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think that Cole possesses the psychic ability to manipulate sounds and images to generate illusions that are so convincing they can kill. How’s that for a theory.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Puts a whole new spin on virtual reality but at least it begins to explain some things.

speaker: SECURITY OFFICER
line: Agent Mulder, see this car in the upper right corner?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah.

speaker: SECURITY OFFICER
line: It wasn’t there five minutes ago.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is this.

speaker: SECURITY OFFICER
line: Track 17. It’s a restricted part of the yard.

speaker: GERARDI
line: What are you doing? This is insane. You can’t do this to me. You can’t hold me responsible. I was following orders, just like you.

speaker: COLE
line: The lord hates the lying tongue.

speaker: GERARDI
line: It’s the truth. Cole hits Gerardi.

speaker: COLE
line: The truth is what you did to us. What you made us do.

speaker: GERARDI
line: No one Made you do anything. You volunteered.

speaker: COLE
line: The righteous shall rejoice when he sees the vengeance.

speaker: GERARDI
line: Who is it? Who’s there.

speaker: COLE
line: He shall wash his feet in the wicked

speaker: GERARDI
line: Who is it. I can’t see without my glasses.

speaker: COLE
line: You don’t need to see to know who it is. You know who it is! Troops are seen walking by and they pick up scalpels.

speaker: COLE
line: You shall pay as the judge has determined. We shall give life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot, burn for burn. Wound for wound, strike for strike. As he has disfigured a man, so shall he be disfigured. And he who kills a man shall be put to death. Mulder and Krycek drive in.

speaker: GERARDI
line: AHHHH!!!! They search the place.

speaker: MULDER
line: He’s still alive. Put pressure on the wound on the back of his neck and radio for help. NOW!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: This is Agent Krycek requesting emergency assistance. My location is track 17 in the freight way house.

speaker: MULDER
line: Step away from the edge. Corporal Cole, I’m a federal agent, now please, step back.

speaker: COLE
line: Go ahead, shoot me.

speaker: MULDER
line: That’s not why I’m here. I’m putting down my gun. I just want to talk to you for a few minutes, after that, you’re free to do whatever you want.

speaker: COLE
line: I’m tired.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know.

speaker: COLE
line: Naw, man, you don’t know. You have no idea.

speaker: MULDER
line: One minute is all I’m asking.

speaker: COLE
line: One minute is more than I can give. My blood’s boilin’ in my veins. I can feel the air stingin’ on my skin.

speaker: MULDER
line: What the military did to you was wrong, but your testimony can help.

speaker: COLE
line: They cut out a part of my brain. They made me into somebody else. I can never get back what they took away from me, and I’m gonna stop them from taking anything more. Krycek walks into the room and extends his weapon.

speaker: MULDER
line: Krycek put down the gun and get out of here. Krycek, I said put down the gun and get out of here! Krycek sees Cole raising a gun. When Mulder looks over, he sees Cole raising his bible.

speaker: MULDER
line: NO!!!!!! Krycek fires his gun twice, killing Cole.

speaker: COLE
line: Good-night.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: He had a gun. He was gonna shoot you.

speaker: MULDER
line: You did the right thing. Mulder reaches under his car seat to find that the file is gone. He goes to Scully’s office.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They broke into my office. Went through my files, my computer. . .I came as soon as security called but the report was all ready gone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Someone went through a lot of trouble stealing both our copies to keep this a secret.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Without that report as evidence, Skinner’s not going to authorize an investigation.

speaker: MULDER
line: He said it’s never been more dangerous.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Skinner?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, the man who leaked us the report. The one who’s been helping us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You actually met with him.

speaker: MULDER
line: He said that closing down the X-Files was just the beginning. That we’ve never been in greater danger.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you trust him

speaker: CANCERMAN
line: Do you know where he got this?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Not yet. But he got it. Which means he’s either found another source, or another source has found him. Sir, if I can recommend something. You’ll see that I have outlined several counter measures.

speaker: CANCERMAN
line: What about Scully?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Reassigning them to other areas seems to have only strengthened their determination. Scully’s a problem. A much larger problem than you described.

speaker: CANCERMAN
line: Every problem has a solution. He puts out his cigarette.
